alert.note: Alert for Hillsborough (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 01 at 10:35AM EDT until September 02 at 9:30PM EDT by NWS Tampa Bay
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... Hillsborough River Near Hillsborough River State Park affecting Hillsborough County. Manatee River Near Myakka Head at SR 64 affecting Manatee County. Horse Creek Near Arcadia at SR 72 affecting DeSoto County. .Flooding continues on several rivers and creeks in the wake of heavy rainfall from Hurricane Idalia. For the Hillsborough...including Morris Bridge, Temple Terrace, Hillsborough River State Park...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Manatee...including Myakka Head at SR 64, Rye Bridge...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Horse Creek...including Arcadia at SR 72...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Hillsborough River near Hillsborough River State Park. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Hillsborough River State Park may be closed. Lowland flooding occurs at the mobile home park near Branchton on State Road 579. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM EDT Friday the stage was 10.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 8.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:00 AM EDT Friday was 10.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.5 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.7 feet on 09/07/1953. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (8 am EDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Tue Wed Hillsborough River Hillsborough Rive 10.0 10.1 Fri 10 am 10.4 8.4 5.7 4.6 4.2 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1000 PM EDT.
